trans-unit.source: How manage user accounts in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How manage user accounts in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create or invite users in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create or invite users in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: How to manage user accounts in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to manage user accounts in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: In API Management, developers are the users of the APIs that you expose using API Management.
trans-unit.target: In API Management, developers are the users of the APIs that you expose using API Management.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows to how to create and invite developers to use the APIs and products that you make available to them with your API Management instance.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows to how to create and invite developers to use the APIs and products that you make available to them with your API Management instance.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Create a new developer
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Create a new developer

trans-unit.source: To create a new developer, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To create a new developer, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Developers from the API Management menu on the left, and then click add user.
trans-unit.target: Click Developers from the API Management menu on the left, and then click add user.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the Email, Password, and Name for the new developer and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Email, Password, and Name for the new developer and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By default, newly created developer accounts are Active, and associated with the Developers group.
trans-unit.target: By default, newly created developer accounts are Active, and associated with the Developers group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Developer accounts that are in an active state can be used to access all of the APIs for which they have subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Developer accounts that are in an active state can be used to access all of the APIs for which they have subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: To associate the newly created developer with additional groups, see <link><linkText>How to associate groups with developers[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To associate the newly created developer with additional groups, see <link><linkText>How to associate groups with developers[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Invite a developer
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Invite a developer

trans-unit.source: To invite a developer, click Developers from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Invite User.
trans-unit.target: To invite a developer, click Developers from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Invite User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the name and email address of the developer, and click Invite.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name and email address of the developer, and click Invite.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A confirmation message is displayed, but the newly invited developer does not appear in the list until after the accept the invitation.
trans-unit.target: A confirmation message is displayed, but the newly invited developer does not appear in the list until after the accept the invitation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite confirmation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite confirmation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When a developer is invited, an email is sent to the developer.
trans-unit.target: When a developer is invited, an email is sent to the developer.

trans-unit.source: This email is generated using a template and is customizable.
trans-unit.target: This email is generated using a template and is customizable.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure email templates[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure email templates[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Once the invitation is accepted, the account becomes active.
trans-unit.target: Once the invitation is accepted, the account becomes active.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html> Deactivate or reactivate a developer account
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html> Deactivate or reactivate a developer account

trans-unit.source: By default, newly created or invited developer accounts are Active.
trans-unit.target: By default, newly created or invited developer accounts are Active.

trans-unit.source: To deactivate a developer account, click Block.
trans-unit.target: To deactivate a developer account, click Block.

trans-unit.source: To reactivate a blocked developer account, click Activate.
trans-unit.target: To reactivate a blocked developer account, click Activate.

trans-unit.source: A blocked developer account can not access the developer portal or call any APIs.
trans-unit.target: A blocked developer account can not access the developer portal or call any APIs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Block developer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Block developer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: Once a developer account is created, you can associate it with roles and subscribe it to products and APIs.
trans-unit.target: Once a developer account is created, you can associate it with roles and subscribe it to products and APIs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to create and use groups[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to create and use groups[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
